</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">format_print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">item</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">motifs</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">pre</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">post</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pre</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s1">'Nuc seq {} was found {} times.'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">item</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">motifs</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">item</span><span class="p">])</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">post</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">except</span> <span class="ne">KeyError</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pre</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s1">'Nuc seq {} was not found in the sequence.'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">item</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">post</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">letter</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="s1">'ACGT'</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">format_print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">letter</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">motifs</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Nuc seq A was found 2498 times.
Nuc seq C was found 2468 times.
Nuc seq G was found 2563 times.
Nuc seq T was found 2551 times.
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">pair</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">itertools</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">combinations</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'ACGT'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">pair</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">''</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pair</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">riap</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pair</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">pair</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">format_print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pair</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">motifs</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">format_print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">riap</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">motifs</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Nuc seq AC was found 603 times.
Nuc seq CA was found 606 times.
Nuc seq AG was found 630 times.
Nuc seq GA was found 640 times.
Nuc seq AT was found 665 times.
Nuc seq TA was found 653 times.
Nuc seq CG was found 641 times.
Nuc seq GC was found 630 times.
Nuc seq CT was found 594 times.
Nuc seq TC was found 607 times.
Nuc seq GT was found 631 times.
Nuc seq TG was found 633 times.
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">long_freq</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">defaultdict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">k</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">v</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">motifs</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">items</span><span class="p">():</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">5</span> <span class="ow">and</span> <span class="n">v</span> <span class="o">></span> <span class="mi">9</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">long_freq</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k</span><span class="p">)]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">></span> <span class="mi">5</span> <span class="ow">and</span> <span class="n">v</span> <span class="o">>=</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">long_freq</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k</span><span class="p">)]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">length</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">long_freq</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">keys</span><span class="p">():</span>
    <span class="k">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Sequences of len {}:'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">length</span><span class="p">))</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">item</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">sorted</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">long_freq</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">length</span><span class="p">]):</span>
        <span class="n">format_print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">item</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">motifs</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">pre</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'  '</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">print</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Sequences of len 5:
  Nuc seq TTTAG was found 10 times.
  Nuc seq TTTTA was found 10 times.

Sequences of len 6:
  Nuc seq CCATGC was found 4 times.
  Nuc seq CCCGTA was found 4 times.
  Nuc seq CTCCTG was found 4 times.
  Nuc seq GGGGGG was found 5 times.
  Nuc seq TAAAGC was found 4 times.
  Nuc seq TATTTA was found 4 times.

Sequences of len 7:
  Nuc seq GGGGGGG was found 4 times.

</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>While the Apriori Principle significantly reduces the number of candidates investigated, and thus the time it takes to process a sequence, significanlty longer sequences -- such a genomes -- can still take a significant amount of time to process.  Thus, the method of finding all frequent patterns is best reserved for shorter sequences.</p>
<p>This also requires that we think about patterns and the "frequent" idea in a slightly different manner.  For instance, finding a 6-mer 4 times in a 500 nucleotide stratch is more significant than finding the motif the same number of times in an entire genome.  One way of contextualizing fequency in terms of the size of the search space is the concept of an $(L, t)$-clump, which we look at next.</p>
<p>Additionally, we need methods that can reduce the search space so that our frequent pattern finding methods can run in a reasonable amount of time.  Below we look at one such method for narrowing down the search space in circular bacterial genomes, <em>GC Skew</em>.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="$(L,-t)$---clumps">$(L, t)$ - clumps<a class="anchor-link" href="#$(L,-t)$---clumps">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>$(L, t)$-clumps help scale the idea of Frequent Patterns to various sized search spaces.  If within a strand of $L$ nucleotides, a $k$-mer is observed $t$ (or more) times, then it is an $(L, t)$.  This provides both a frequency benchmark and a search space reference for evaluating and comparing patterns.</p>
<p>This also introduces the idea of a number of occurrances of a particular $k$-mer within the same region of a genome.  For instance, a $k$-mer may appear too infrequently to make it an "interesting" pattern with regards to the the entire genome, but if all or most of those occurrences are in a very small region of the genome, then it becomes interesting.</p>
<p>As before for Frequent Patterns, searching the entire genome for $(L, t)$-clumps is problimatic.  At first glance, one may consider simply splitting the entire sequence into clumps and finding the motifs that occur in each clump at least $t$ times.  However, what about the case where a $k$-mer occurs at least $t$ times in a span of size $L$, but that span is split between two clumps?  A "split-and-stich" approach could be suggested, but the problem is always present.  So, we cannot get $(L, t)$-clumps from simply slitting the genome into parts and counting "intelligently".</p>
<p>Splitting up the data and counting $k$-mer occurrences in each sequence is only possible if, instead of simply getting the raw count for each $k$-mer, the start location of each $k$-mer instance is recorded.  Then, the start locations for each $k$-mer can be analyzed to see if $t$ of them occur within a span of length $L$.</p>
<p>There is still an issue though.  What if a $k$-mer starts in one clump and ends in the next clump?  Even though that $k$-mer exists in the data, it is never recorded as it does not appear completly in any data subset analyzed.  One way to get around this issue is to patch on the first $(k-1)$ nucleotides from the $(n+1)$-th clump onto the end of the $n$-th clump.</p>
<p>While this prevents missing out on $k$-mers, it adds in a slight complication for how $(L, t)$-clumps are determined.  That is, a $k$-mer with at least $t$ start points in a span $L$ may not be completly contained within said span.  This is mostly irrelevant for instances where $k \ll L$, though could cause issues when $k = O(L)$.</p>
<p>Because a method exists for locating $(L, t)$-clumps by splitting the overall sequence into clumps and processing them individually, parallel processing can be utilized.  A similar notion applies to the post-counting processing of each $k$-mer found in the data in order to determine which have $(L, t)$-clumps.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [20]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">ltclump_check</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clump</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">kmer</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">count</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">find_all_motif_locations</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clump</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">kmer</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">count</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">count_kmers</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sequence</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">k</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">kmer_counts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">defaultdict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">start</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sequence</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">k</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="n">kmer_counts</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sequence</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">start</span><span class="p">:(</span><span class="n">start</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">k</span><span class="p">)])]</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
    <span class="n">kmer_counts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kmer_counts</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kmer_counts</span><span class="p">)</span>


<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">find_kmer_starts</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sequence</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">k</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">offset</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">collections</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">defaultdict</span>
    
    <span class="n">kmer_starts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">defaultdict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">start</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sequence</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">k</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="n">kmer_starts</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sequence</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">start</span><span class="p">:(</span><span class="n">start</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">k</span><span class="p">)])]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">start</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">offset</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">kmer_starts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kmer_starts</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kmer_starts</span><span class="p">)</span>


<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">processClump</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clump</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clump_ind</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clump_offset</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">k</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">clump</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clump</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">L</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clump</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">kmer_starts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">find_kmer_starts</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clump</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">k</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">offset</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">clump_offset</span><span class="p">)</span>  
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">clump_ind</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">kmer_starts</span><span class="p">))</span>


<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">mergeClumps</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clumps</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="c1"># clumps = [(clump_id, kmer_starts)]</span>
    <span class="n">kmer_starts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">defaultdict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">clump</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">clumps</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">kmer</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">starts</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">clump</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">items</span><span class="p">():</span>
            <span class="n">kmer_starts</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">kmer</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">update</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">starts</span><span class="p">))</span>
    <span class="n">kmer_starts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kmer_starts</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kmer_starts</span><span class="p">)</span>


<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">detectLTClump</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kmer</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">starts</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">L</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">lt_clumps</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
    
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">starts</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">starts</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">s</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">sorted</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">starts</span><span class="p">))]</span>
        <span class="n">ind</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
        
        <span class="k">while</span> <span class="n">ind</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">starts</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">):</span>
            <span class="c1"># Do at least t starts occur within L?</span>
            <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">starts</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">ind</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">starts</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">ind</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="n">L</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="n">span</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">t</span>
                <span class="c1"># How many starts are within L?</span>
                <span class="k">while</span> <span class="bp">True</span><span class="p">:</span>
                    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">ind</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">span</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">starts</span><span class="p">):</span>
                        <span class="k">break</span>
                    <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">starts</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">ind</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">span</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">starts</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">ind</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">></span> <span class="n">L</span><span class="p">:</span>
                        <span class="k">break</span>
                    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
                        <span class="n">span</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
                <span class="n">lt_clumps</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">starts</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">ind</span><span class="p">:(</span><span class="n">ind</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">span</span><span class="p">)])</span>
                
            <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="n">span</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
                
            <span class="n">ind</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="n">span</span>
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="n">kmer</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">lt_clumps</span><span class="p">})</span>


<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">detectLTClumps</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">results</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">L</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">lt_clumps</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{}</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">kmer</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">starts</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">items</span><span class="p">():</span>
        <span class="n">lt_clumps</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">update</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">detectLTClump</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kmer</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">starts</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">L</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="p">))</span>
    <span class="n">lt_clumps</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="n">k</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">v</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">k</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">v</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">lt_clumps</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">items</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">v</span><span class="p">}</span>
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">lt_clumps</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [21]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">findLTClumps</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">record</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">k</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">L</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">view</span><span class="p">):</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Push these functions to the view</span>
    <span class="n">view</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">push</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">find_kmer_starts</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">find_kmer_starts</span><span class="p">,</span>
                   <span class="n">processClump</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">processClump</span><span class="p">));</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Define start, end locations for slices</span>
    <span class="n">spacing</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">min</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">record</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">k</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">start_inds</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">record</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="n">spacing</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">inds</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">zip</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">start_inds</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">s</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">spacing</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">k</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">start_inds</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="n">sub_seqs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">record</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">seq</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]:</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">x</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">inds</span><span class="p">]</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Do stuff, merge results</span>
    <span class="n">results</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">view</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">map_sync</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">clump</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clump_ind</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clump_offset</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">k</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">processClump</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clump</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                                                                                   <span class="n">clump_ind</span><span class="p">,</span>
                                                                                   <span class="n">clump_offset</span><span class="p">,</span>
                                                                                   <span class="n">k</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">sub_seqs</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">start_inds</span><span class="p">)),</span> <span class="n">start_inds</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">k</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">_</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">start_inds</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="n">results</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[(</span><span class="n">a</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">b</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">a</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">b</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">results</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">b</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">results</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">></span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">results</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">mergeClumps</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">results</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">results</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">results</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Get the lt_clumps</span>
    <span class="n">lt_clumps</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">detectLTClumps</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">results</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">L</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">lt_clumps</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [22]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">ltc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">findLTClumps</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">record</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">k</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">,</span>  <span class="n">L</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">2000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">view</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">lv</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">

</pre></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="GC-Skew">GC Skew<a class="anchor-link" href="#GC-Skew">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [24]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">calcGCSkew</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">seq</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">current_skew</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
    <span class="n">gc_skew</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">numpy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">zeros</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">seq</span><span class="p">)))</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">nuc</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">enumerate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">seq</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">nuc</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s2">"G"</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">current_skew</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
        <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">nuc</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s2">"C"</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">current_skew</span> <span class="o">-=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
        <span class="n">gc_skew</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">current_skew</span>
    <span class="n">gc_skew</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pandas</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Series</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">gc_skew</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">gc_skew</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">find_minmax_gcskew</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">gc_skew</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">pos2neg</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">numpy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">argmax</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">gc_skew</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">neg2pos</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">numpy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">argmin</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">gc_skew</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">'oriC_pos'</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">neg2pos</span><span class="p">,</span>
            <span class="s1">'terC_pos'</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">pos2neg</span><span class="p">})</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [25]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">sequence_gcskew</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">calcGCSkew</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">record</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">seq</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [26]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Init Plot</span>
<span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">figsize</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">));</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'GC Skew for Random Sequence'</span><span class="p">);</span>

<span class="c1"># Axis Labels</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Position"</span><span class="p">);</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"GC Skew"</span><span class="p">);</span>


<span class="n">g</span><span class="p">,</span>  <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sequence_gcskew</span><span class="p">,</span>
              <span class="n">c</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"green"</span><span class="p">,</span>
              <span class="n">markersize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">);</span>

<span class="c1"># Set Axis limits</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xlim</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sequence_gcskew</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">);</span>
</pre></div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>No real descernable pattern in the <em>GC Skew</em> plot for the random nucleotide sequence.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Approximate-Matches">Approximate Matches<a class="anchor-link" href="#Approximate-Matches">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Because mutations of nucleotides are common in genomes, we may consider occurrences of highly-similar sequences to be one in the same for the purposes of detecting patterns in the genome.</p>
<p>By using approximate matching for motifs, we may be able to uncover trends and patterns that were not exposed by simply using exact sequence matches.  Various methods exist for assessing partial matches.  For our current purposes, the Hamming Distance is the metric we will utilize.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Hamming-Distance">Hamming Distance<a class="anchor-link" href="#Hamming-Distance">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>One method for evaluating the distance between sequences is the Hamming Distance.  The Hamming Distance is the total number of mis-matched nucleotides for two sequences of the same length.  This can be calculated by simply subtracting the total number of matched positions two sequences have from the length of the sequences.  Motifs with small Hamming Distances can then be grouped together and occurrences of all motifs in a group can be used to determine if a Frequent Pattern or $(L,t)$-clump has been found.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [27]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">seq1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'atcgatcg'</span>
<span class="n">seq2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'acgtgtag'</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [28]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">hammingDist</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">seq1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">seq2</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">hd</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">seq1</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="nb">sum</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">a</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="n">b</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">a</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">b</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">zip</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">seq1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">seq2</span><span class="p">)])</span>
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">hd</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [29]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">hammingDist</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">seq1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">seq2</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[29]:</div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>5</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Integrating-Hamming-Distance-with-Other-Methods">Integrating Hamming Distance with Other Methods<a class="anchor-link" href="#Integrating-Hamming-Distance-with-Other-Methods">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Calculating the Hamming Distance for pairs of sequences is straight-forward.  In order to utilize it in practice, though, it needs to be integrated with the methods discussed above.  The first step in doing so is calculating the pairwise Hamming Distances for all $k$-mers of interest.</p>
<p>Once pairwise Hamming Distances are calculated, $k$-mers need to be grouped.  Typically this is done by starting with a "base" $k$-mer and associating all other $k$-mers within a distance $d$ with that $k$-mer. Then, for each group of $k$-mers, the metric in question is calculated.</p>
<p>Note that to do this, the initial counting steps for each unique $k$-mer can proceede as follows.  Only the count filtering and final summary steps need to be modified to account for all $k$-mers in each group.</p>
<p>For example, is the case of $(L,t$)-clumps, start positions are located as before.  Then, for each $k$-mer group, the start locations from all distinct $k$-mers in the group are merged and ordered.  The $(L,t)$-clump detection algorithm is then carried out on the new list of start positions.  This process is carried out below.  Note that the number of "hits" increases significantly from the previous case.</p>
<p>Some additional notes about the implimentation.  Because such a large number of $k$-mers can be found in the data, calculating the pairwise Hamming Distances can get expensive if "for" loops are used.  Thus, the "ACGT" strings are converted to numeric vectors, and <em>scipy.spatial</em> is utilized for calculating the distances between $k$-mers.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [30]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">hammingDistsLetters</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="c1"># Works for a small number of candidate k-mers</span>
    <span class="n">dists</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">numpy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">zeros</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">)),</span> <span class="n">dtype</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'int8'</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="n">seq1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">j</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">)):</span>
            <span class="n">seq2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">j</span><span class="p">]</span>
            <span class="n">hd</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">hammingDist</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">seq1</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">seq1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">seq2</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">seq2</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">dists</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">j</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">hd</span>
            
    <span class="n">dists</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="n">dists</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">transpose</span><span class="p">()</span>
    
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dists</span><span class="p">)</span>


<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">hammingDistsDigits</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">k</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Encode k-mers</span>
    <span class="n">lookup</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'A'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'C'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'G'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'T'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">}</span>
    <span class="n">k_mers</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">numpy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">array</span><span class="p">([[</span><span class="n">lookup</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">l</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">l</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">k_mer</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">k_mer</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">],</span>
                         <span class="n">dtype</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="c1"># Calculate distances</span>
    <span class="n">dists</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">scipy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">spatial</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">distance</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">squareform</span><span class="p">(</span>\
                                              <span class="n">scipy</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">spatial</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">distance</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">pdist</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">metric</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'hamming'</span><span class="p">))</span>
    <span class="n">dists</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dists</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">k</span>
    <span class="n">dists</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dists</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'int16'</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dists</span><span class="p">)</span>



<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">groupSimilarKMers</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">dmax</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">dmetric</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'hamming'</span><span class="p">):</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Calculate pairwise distances</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">dmetric</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'hamming'</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">dists</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">hammingDistsDigits</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Find all close k_mers to each k_mer (including self)</span>
    <span class="n">kmer_groups</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{}</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">kmer</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">enumerate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="n">close</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">k</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">k</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">val</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">enumerate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dists</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,:]</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="n">dmax</span><span class="p">))</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">val</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="n">kmer_groups</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">kmer</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">close</span>

    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kmer_groups</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [31]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">mergeSimilarKMerAttr</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kmer_groups</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">attr_values</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">attr</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'starts'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">dmax</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">):</span>
        
    <span class="n">new_attr_values</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{}</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">k_mer</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sim_kmers</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">kmer_groups</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">items</span><span class="p">():</span>
        
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">attr</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'counts'</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="c1"># count is an int</span>
            <span class="n">new_value</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
            <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">km</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">sim_kmers</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="n">new_value</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="n">attr_values</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">km</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">attr</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'starts'</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="c1"># Starts are a set</span>
            <span class="n">new_value</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">()</span>
            <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">km</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">sim_kmers</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="n">new_value</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">update</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">attr_values</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">km</span><span class="p">])</span>
                
        <span class="n">new_attr_values</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">k_mer</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">new_value</span>
            
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">new_attr_values</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [32]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">findApproxLTClumps</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">record</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">k</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">L</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">view</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">dmax</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">):</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Push these functions to the view</span>
    <span class="n">view</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">push</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">find_kmer_starts</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">find_kmer_starts</span><span class="p">,</span>
                 <span class="n">processClump</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">processClump</span><span class="p">));</span>
    
    
    <span class="c1"># Define start, end locations for slices</span>
    <span class="n">spacing</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">min</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">record</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">k</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">start_inds</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">record</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="n">spacing</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">inds</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">zip</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">start_inds</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">s</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">spacing</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">k</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">start_inds</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="n">sub_seqs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">record</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">seq</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]:</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">x</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">inds</span><span class="p">]</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Do stuff, merge results</span>
    <span class="n">results</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">view</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">map_sync</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">clump</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clump_ind</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clump_offset</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">k</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">processClump</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clump</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                                                                                 <span class="n">clump_ind</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                                                                                 <span class="n">clump_offset</span><span class="p">,</span>
                                                                                 <span class="n">k</span><span class="p">),</span>
                          <span class="n">sub_seqs</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">start_inds</span><span class="p">)),</span> <span class="n">start_inds</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">k</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">_</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">start_inds</span><span class="p">])</span>    
    <span class="n">results</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[(</span><span class="n">a</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">b</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">a</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">b</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">results</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">b</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">results</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">></span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">results</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">mergeClumps</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">results</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">results</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">results</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Get groups and merge starts for approx k-mers</span>
    <span class="n">k_mers</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">km</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">km</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">results</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">keys</span><span class="p">()]</span>
    <span class="n">kmer_groups</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">groupSimilarKMers</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k_mers</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">dmax</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">dmax</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">results</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">mergeSimilarKMerAttr</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">kmer_groups</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">results</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">attr</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'starts'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">dmax</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">dmax</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Get the lt_clumps</span>
    <span class="n">lt_clumps</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">detectLTClumps</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">results</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">L</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># Add info about similar sequences</span>
    <span class="n">lt_clumps</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="n">k</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'clumps'</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">c</span><span class="p">,</span>
                      <span class="s1">'sim_kmers'</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">akm</span><span class="p">}</span> \
                 <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">k</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">c</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">akm</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">zip</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">lt_clumps</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">keys</span><span class="p">(),</span> 
                                    <span class="n">lt_clumps</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">values</span><span class="p">(),</span>
                                    <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">kmer_groups</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">km</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">km</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">lt_clumps</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">keys</span><span class="p">()])</span>
                <span class="p">}</span>
    
    <span class="k">return</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">lt_clumps</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [33]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">ltc_approx</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">findApproxLTClumps</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">record</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">record</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">k</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">L</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">view</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">lv</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [34]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">k</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">ltc_approx</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">keys</span><span class="p">():</span>
    <span class="k">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'k-mer {} has clumps {}'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">k</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ltc_approx</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">k</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="s1">'clumps'</span><span class="p">]))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>k-mer GGATAGCA has clumps [[1096, 1111, 1291, 1436, 1545, 1721, 7203]]
k-mer ATGCAGTC has clumps [[8447, 8574, 8871, 9049, 9120, 9239, 9313]]
k-mer TCAGCCCG has clumps [[6885, 7321, 7651, 7829, 7843, 7861]]
k-mer CGGCGGTA has clumps [[7623, 7633, 7929, 8057, 8157, 8227]]
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Finding-oriC-in-V.-cholerae">Finding <em>oriC</em> in <em>V. cholerae</em><a class="anchor-link" href="#Finding-oriC-in-V.-cholerae">¶</a></h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now that we have our tools in place, we will use them to attempt to locate the <em>oriC</em> and <em>DnaA</em> boxes in a strand of <em>V. cholerae</em> that is similar to but not the same as the stand used in the text as an example.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Retrieve-Genome">Retrieve Genome<a class="anchor-link" href="#Retrieve-Genome">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The first step is to obtain the genome for the strand of <em>V. cholera</em> of interest.  The NCBI page for the strand being used can be found <a href="https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/nuccore/NZ_CP013302.1">here</a>.  Note that the strand is itentified by a unique ID -- CP013302.1 -- that can be used by the <em>Biopython</em> package to retrieve the genome from Entrez.  This is done below.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [35]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#vibcho_id = "CP007653.1"</span>
<span class="c1">#vibcho_id = "CP007654.1"</span>
<span class="n">vibcho_id</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"CP013302.1"</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [36]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">db</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"nucleotide"</span>
<span class="n">rettype</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"gb"</span>
<span class="n">retmode</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"text"</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [37]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">Entrez</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">email</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"immersinn@gmail.com"</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [38]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">handle</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Entrez</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">efetch</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">db</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">db</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">vibcho_id</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rettype</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">rettype</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">retmode</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">retmode</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">vibcho_rec</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">SeqIO</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">handle</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rettype</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">handle</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">close</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [39]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">print_record_descrip</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">record</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"{} ({}...) with {} features"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">record</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">id</span><span class="p">,</span>
                                               <span class="n">record</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">description</span><span class="p">[:</span><span class="mi">50</span><span class="p">],</span>
                                               <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">record</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">features</span><span class="p">)))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [40]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">print_record_descrip</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">vibcho_rec</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>CP013302.1 (Vibrio cholerae strain C5 chromosome 2, complete s...) with 2369 features
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Step-Through-the-Process">Step Through the Process<a class="anchor-link" href="#Step-Through-the-Process">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Once the genome has been obtained, the search for <em>oriC</em> and <em>DnaA</em> boxes can begin.</p>
<p>The first step here is to search for the <em>oriC</em> region by using GC Skew.  After a reasonable region for <em>oriC</em> has been obtained via this method, the next step is to look for $(L,t)$-clumps in the region.  Two different $L$ values are tested, 300 and 500.</p>
<p>Next, the nucleotide sequences that have $(L,t)$-clumps are checked to see if their revere complement also has a $(L,t)$-clump in the same region.  This is a halmark feature of a <em>DnaA</em> box.</p>
<p>By using $L = 300$, the sequences (the main sequence and its reverse complement) corresponding to the <em>DnaA</em> box described in the text are recovered.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Calculate-&-Plot-GC-Skew">Calculate & Plot GC Skew<a class="anchor-link" href="#Calculate-&-Plot-GC-Skew">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>By using the GC Skew tools from above, the start of the <em>oriC</em> region seems to be around nucleotide 80.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [41]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">vibcho_gcskew</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">calcGCSkew</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">vibcho_rec</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">seq</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [42]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Init Plot</span>
<span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">figsize</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">));</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'GC Skew for V. cholerae'</span><span class="p">);</span>

<span class="c1"># Axis Labels</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Position"</span><span class="p">);</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"GC Skew"</span><span class="p">);</span>


<span class="n">g</span><span class="p">,</span>  <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">vibcho_gcskew</span><span class="p">,</span>
              <span class="n">c</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"green"</span><span class="p">,</span>
              <span class="n">markersize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">);</span>

<span class="c1"># Set Axis limits</span>
<span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xlim</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">vibcho_gcskew</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">);</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area"><div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
